text: three weeks ago we made this buyer
beware video this is a cautionary tale
about how we ordered sales through a
reputable sale manufacturer paid in full
and 21 months later we still don't have
any sales and it caused quite the stir
within the sailing community so it's not
a video we wanted to make but we felt a
responsibility to our fellow sailors we
didn't make the video seeking action it
was just our buyer beware statement
within hours of posting the video we had
an email from dd the ceo of one sales
headquarters in italy wanting to remedy
the situation with his personal phone
number to talk which we very much
appreciated and he was very honest in
his discussion with us and explained
that they have a court case against the
sail maker south africa and that the
sale makers no longer represent one
sales because the sale makers don't work
with one sales anymore the sales would
not have had a warranty from
headquarters which of course is
something that we would need to have so
one sales headquarters offered us a full
reimbursement and i am happy to report
they were very swift and the money is
sitting in our account so thank you one
sales and tv what are we doing for new
sales funny story
our syrup
we're so distracting our sales right now
are from almond sales in south africa
well minus the actual mainsail that is
original to the boat 16 years old very
baggy and threadbare but surprisingly
has made it this far ullman was founded
in 1967 by california native david
ullman and they make sales for leopard
catamarans so they know the boats
intimately which makes for a very
reliable easy and fuss-free order which
is why we ordered our genoa
our beautiful yellow spinnaker and this
stack pack from allman
around six years ago just after we
bought the boat and we had contacted
them first for our new sales but because
they were so busy at the time they
couldn't complete the order in the time
frame that we needed and that's how we
ended up looking for another loft now
we've come full circle and then some
because we have not lost faith in doing
business in south africa we love the
country the people
and the sailing community there which is
why we are very excited to say that
ullman south africa have offered to make
our sales and dimension pollyant is
donating the cloth so a huge thank you
to both of you to talk about silver
linings this means we're finally gonna
get the sales that we need and this
leaves us with the refund money
which in the spirit of paying it forward
we have decided to donate we're gonna
give 90 percent to conservation
international whose mission is to
empower societies to responsibly and
sustainably care for nature and our
global biodiversity for the well-being
of humanity then 10
will go to mutiny ranch it's a farm
animal sanctuary in colorado created by
our longtime friends lynn and clark who
provide a loving home to animals in need
plus
singa apparently just got employee of
the month and asked for a raise so we
figured we'd better chip in
so there you have it we should have our
new sales by early february and we were
